subject: Photography
title: The Rise of Visual Misinformation
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Rise of Visual Misinformation.

hook.text: A viral photo shows something shocking. You share it. But it was taken in a different country, five years ago.

buildup.text: Out-of-context images are the most common form of visual misinformation â€” real photos used to tell false stories.

discovery.text: Reverse image search tools can trace a photo's origin. But most people share without checking first.

twist.text: Visual misinformation spreads faster than text-based lies. The brain processes images as inherently trustworthy.

climax.text: Media literacy â€” the ability to critically evaluate images â€” is becoming as important as reading literacy.

punchline.text: Don't trust a photo until you've verified its source.

quiz.question: What is the most common form of visual misinformation?
options: Real photos taken out of context and used to tell false stories
